intro: Baliospermum calycinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Baliospermum calycinum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
